snippet: President Obama laid bare the political dilemma he faced on environmental issues, including the fate of the controversial Keystone XL pipeline from Canada.
abstract: Pres Obama, in Northern California on his first fund-raising drive in hopes of winning friendlier Congress in 2014 elections, tells donors he faces tough political dilemma on environmental issues; he appears to be leaning toward approval of Keystone XL pipeline, acknowledging difficulty of selling aggressive environmental action to Americans struggling in difficult economy to pay bills, buy gas and save for retirement.

byline.contributor: John M. Broder contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: President Obama laid bare the political dilemma he faced on environmental issues, including the fate of the controversial Keystone XL pipeline from Canada.

headline.seo: Obama Tells Donors of Tough Politics of Environment
headline.main: Obama Tells Donors of Tough Politics of Environment
headline.print_headline: Obama’s Fund-Raising Trip Becomes Forum on Pipeline
